A_Leaf River Cluster Development - SIP Panel Condominium Project

Construction Strategy: Two Paths Forward
We can still build modern homes with two clear paths:
Path 1: SIP Panels (Preferred)
The opportunity: SIP manufacturers charge more because it's "fancy" but in quantity we can get
the price down. The materials aren't expensive - foam and OSB/MgO are cheap. With 160 units
we have volume leverage.
Benefits of SIP panels:
● Superior energy efficiency (can include utilities and profit from the difference)
● Modern construction appeals to investors
● Enhanced returns for investors through utility savings
● Volume pricing should drive costs down to competitive levels
Path 2: Stick-Built (Backup)
If we can't get SIP pricing down, we can go stick-built with local contractors. Won't be as energy
efficient but still works financially.
Target Construction Costs
Method Cost/SF Notes
SIP Panels (Volume) $130-140/SF Target through volume negotiations
Stick-Built $120-130/SF Backup if SIP pricing doesn't work
Key Points
● Volume benefits pricing - Everything works better at scale
● Utility strategy - SIP efficiency allows us to charge flat fee and profit
● Condominiumization - Doesn't have to look like condos, just be condos legally
● Market validation - Deposits go in escrow, provides downside protection
● Cluster development - Mix of unit sizes, natural layout
● Strong demand - Both student housing and workforce housing are excellent markets
